text: John Philip Holland () (29 February 184012 August 1914John Philip Holland article, Encyclopaedia Britannica) was an Irish-American engineer. He developed the first submarine to be formally commissioned by the U.S. Navy. He also created the first Royal Navy submarine, the Holland 1. He is often known as the father of the modern submarine for his designs. Holland died on 12 August 1914 in Newark, New Jersey, aged 74. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1840 births Category:1914 deaths Category:American engineers Category:Marine engineers Category:People from County Clare
title: John Philip Holland
